sentences.english: Should we make a reservation if we are going to have morning tea tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 如果我们明天来饮早茶需不需要预订？

sentences.english: We offer free wake-up tea and Internet service.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供免费的叫醒早茶和网络服务。

sentences.english: Usually, the old men will drink morning tea, which is their main relaxation during leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 通常喝早茶的是老年人，这是他们闲暇时主要的活动。

sentences.english: TEA PALACE Tea palace is a Chinese restaurant mainly offering Cantonese morning tea.
sentences.chinese: 茶皇殿是以粤式早茶为主的中式餐厅。

sentences.english: I seem to fritter my time away at coffee mornings.
sentences.chinese: 我似乎把时间全都浪费在咖啡早茶会上了。

sentences.english: Pingyang Tezaocha is a tea clone of shrub, medium leaf and extra-early sprouting.
sentences.chinese: 平阳特早茶属灌木型中叶类特早生种。

sentences.english: Our breakfast supply Cantonese early morning cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 我们的早餐主要供应粤式早茶。

sentences.english: After three breakfasts it's time for some sweeties for morning tea.
sentences.chinese: 在吃过三顿早饭之后，现在是早茶时间。

sentences.english: I came around here for morning tea and it all went from there, didn't it really?
sentences.chinese: 我来这里喝早茶，一切就这样开始了，对吗？

sentences.english: Lots of morning tea, lunch and drinks peppered the day.
sentences.chinese: 大量的早茶，午餐和饮料胡椒的一天。

sentences.english: Our your morning meing supply Could likeonese early morning cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 我们的早餐紧要供给粤式早茶。

sentences.english: Cheese wafers and potato chips are really very good snacks for coffee break.
sentences.chinese: 喝早茶时吃些奶酪薄片和炸薯条最好不过了。

sentences.english: Breakfast is the cousin cousin went to the club to drink tea with.
sentences.chinese: 早餐就是表哥带表弟去会所喝的早茶。

sentences.english: Except for scenery, the Guangzhou Food is very famous, the soup and morning tea especially.
sentences.chinese: 除了风景以外，广州美食也很出名，特别是汤和早茶。

sentences.english: Our breakfast supply Cantonese early morning tea.
sentences.chinese: 我们的早餐主要供应粤式早茶。

definition: afternoon tea (light afternoon meal, typically pastries with tea or coffee)
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒麥|烧麦[shao1 mai4]
rice noodle roll, a roll made from sheets of rice flour dough, steamed and stuffed with meat, vegetables etc
siu mei/spit-roasted meat dish in Cantonese cuisine
tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
fried radish cake (a type of dim sum, commonly called "turnip cake")
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
food stall/open-air restaurant (originally Hong Kong usage, now usually written as 大排檔|大排档[da4 pai2 dang4]
